data: Verify that an 'Admit to' Order has been entered prior to completing the powerplan (NOT required for direct admit patients)

When discharge criteria met: 
 -SpO2 greater than 90% while off oxygen for 12 hours (includes periods of sleep)
- Respiratory rate less than 60 breaths/minute, minimal work of breathing (no more than mild indrawing) for 6 hours
- No wall suctioning required for 6 hours
- Feeding well to maintain hydration off IV fluids for 6 hours (Urine Output greater than or equal to 1 mL/kg/h)
q4h, heart rate, BP, respiratory rate, temperature
q2h, heart rate, BP, respiratory rate, temperature
q1h, heart rate, BP, respiratory rate, temperature
q4h, when continuous pulse oximetry greater than 90% for greater than 2 hours on room air, minimal work of breathing, and no concerns from bedside nurse
Start: NPO, Adjust/Advance Diet to: General Diet
Consider tube feeding in a child with increased work of breathing (Respirations greater than 60 breaths per minute)
PED Peripheral IV and IV Fluids (Module)
400 unit, PO, qdaily, drug form: oral liq
BC Children's Hospital Empiric Antimicrobial Guide
15 mg/kg, PO, q4h, PRN pain-mild, drug form: oral liq [Greater Than or Equal To 3 month]
12.5 mg/kg, PO, q4h, PRN pain-mild, drug form: oral liq
10 mg/kg, PO, q4h, PRN pain-mild, drug form: oral liq

5 mg/kg, PO, q8h, PRN pain-mild, drug form: oral liq

Influenza A/B NAT CWH (available from December 1 to April 30) should only be ordered for:    -Children and Women's Hospital (CWH) pediatric (less than 19 years old) and adult patients    -non-CWH site pediatric patients (less than 19 years old)
